intro: Soldanella × ganderi, commonly known as the hybrid snowdrop, is a flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Soldanella alpina and Soldanella glauca, both of which are alpine species. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
